questions.question_text:
An engineer is going to redesign a network, and while looking at the QoS configuration, the engineer sees that a portion of the network is marked with AF42.
Which type of traffic is marked with this tag?

discussion.content: Selected Answer: B

Selected Answer: D
QoS Baseline recommendation for **Streaming-Video*** marking is AF32, AF33 & CS4 which is not AF42. Interactive Video (Video Conferencing) is marked AF41, AF42, AF43. The Correct Answer is D 10000%
https://www.ciscopress.com/articles/article.asp?p=357102&seqNum=2 
&
https://www.researchgate.net/figure/Mappings-between-DSCP-and-MPLS-EXP-Bits-Sogay-2013-To-provide-the-QoS-we-have_fig86_325988616

Selected Answer: B
https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/td/docs/solutions/CVD/Collaboration/hybrid/12x/hybcvd/bwm.html

D seems to be the correct one. Interactive-Video
" When provisioning for Interactive-Video (video conferencing) traffic, the following guidelines are recommended" https://www.ciscopress.com/articles/article.asp?p=357102&seqNum=2

Interactive-Video traffic should be marked to DSCP AF41; excess videoconferencing traffic can be marked down by a policer to AF42 or AF43.

Selected Answer: B
AF42 specifically indicates a certain level of priority or service quality for a particular type of traffic. In this case, AF42 is typically used to mark streaming video traffic, which requires a moderate amount of bandwidth and a low to moderate level of delay and packet loss tolerance. Therefore, option B (streaming video) is the correct answer.
While AF42 can be used for video conferencing traffic in some cases, it is more commonly used for streaming video traffic. This is because video conferencing traffic requires a higher level of QoS to ensure good call quality, and is typically marked with a higher priority value such as AF41 or EF (Expedited Forwarding) to ensure that it receives the necessary bandwidth and low latency it needs to function well.

Selected Answer: D
AF42 is a DSCP value that indicates Assured Forwarding (AF) class 4, which provides medium-high drop probability and moderate latency for traffic with a class selector (CS) value of 4 and a drop precedence (DP) value of 2. This type of marking is commonly used for video conferencing traffic. Therefore, the correct answer is D, video conference.

Selected Answer: D
https://www.cisco.com/en/US/technologies/tk543/tk759/technologies_white_paper0900aecd80295a9b.pdf

Selected Answer: D
Interactive-Video traffic should be marked to DSCP AF41; excess videoconferencing traffic can be marked down by a policer to AF42 or AF43.

comments.content: It says in that link, *Streaming video as dscp 32 or cs4*, B is not correct

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
I vote B. Streaming. 
Interactive Video - Sensitive but can tolerate packet loss of about 1% and latency almost same as voice = AF41 per Cisco guidance.
Streaming Video - Less sensitive - can tolerate about 4-5% packet loss and latency of about 4-5 seconds...stands to reason that Streaming as it is less sensitive should have a higher drop probability (AKA DSCP42) as compared to Video Conference.

https://community.cisco.com/t5/collaboration-applications/qos-why-dscp-af-41-for-video/td-p/2241293

Selected Answer: D
D is the correct answer:
Interactive Video (Video Conference) is marked AF41. if a Policing solution exists on the path, and the Bandwidth limit for the queue is reached, excess traffic would be marked down to AF42 or AF43 which makes them more likely to be dropped.

comments.content: Nope, streaming video is CS4, multimedia conferencing is AF41, AF42, AF43

discussion.content:
The correct answer is B (Streaming Video). 
Opportunistic video - AF42; 36 - Includes video streams (main video and presentations or content) and related RTCP packets.
https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/td/docs/solutions/CVD/Collaboration/hybrid/12x/hybcvd/bwm.html#95240

Interactive-Video

When provisioning for Interactive-Video (video conferencing) traffic, the following guidelines are recommended:

 Interactive-Video traffic should be marked to DSCP AF41; excess videoconferencing traffic can be marked down by a policer to AF42 or AF43.

I thought video conference was AF41 and not AF42.

We sure this is D?

questions.question_text: How many minutes does it take for automatic fallback to occur in a Presence Redundancy Group if the primary node lost a critical service?
questions.answer_description:
Enable Automatic Fallbackג€"This parameter specifies whether to do automatic fallback. In the event of a failover, the IM and Presence Service moves users automatically from the backup node to the primary node thirty minutes after the primary node returns to a healthy state.
Reference:
https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/td/docs/voice_ip_comm/cucm/im_presence/configAdminGuide/11_5_1/cup0_b_config-and-admin-guide-1151su5/ cup0_b_imp-system-configuration-1151su5_chapter_0100.html

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
C is correct.

Automatic fallback takes place when the server monitors the services and the Server Recovery Manager (SRM) service automatically fallback users to their homed nodes. The key in this configuration is that the Server Recovery Manager (SRM) service waits 30 minutes for a failed service/server to remain active before an automatic fallback is initiated. Once this 30-minute uptime is established, user sessions are moved back to their homed nodes. The Jabber client then applies the re-log in upper and lower limits for the fallback. 

https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/support/docs/unified-communications/unified-communications-manager-im-presence-service/200958-IM-and-Presence-Server-High-Availability.html

questions.question_text: A company wants to enable secure communications with remote users. Which statement describes the functions of Expressway-E devices in the Cisco collaboration architecture?

choices.C: Expressway-E supports video calls and IM and Presence federation, whereas Cisco Unified Border Element provides only voice calls functionality.
choices.B: Expressway-E supports video calls and IM and Presence federation, whereas Cisco Unified Border Element provides only voice calls and IM and Presence federation functionality.
choices.D: Expressway-E supports voice calls video calls, and IM and Presence federation, whereas Cisco Unified Border Element provides only voice calls functionality.
choices.A: Expressway-E supports voice calls, video calls, and IM and Presence federation, whereas Cisco Unified Border Element provides only voice and video calls functionality.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
For instance, CUBE supports voice and video, nothing else. So B., C., and D. are incorrect.

Selected Answer: A
Confirming A.

Good review video on CUBE:
https://youtu.be/GZBEDx72lqo

questions.question_text: When setting a new primary DNS server in the Cisco UCM CLI, what is required for the change to take effect?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
Cisco Unified Serviceability--> Tools--> Control Center - Network Services

Selected Answer: A
You cannot restart the "network service". 
Cisco says you need to restart the server > the best answer is A
Recommendation is to restart the cluster >therefore will go for C

Selected Answer: C
if restarting the cluster means Call Manager service, then answer A is correct, else C is correct.

Selected Answer: C
restart network service

Selected Answer: C
You don't have to restart the call manager service. Actually according to this guide (read at the bottom) you don't have to restart anything, it restarts network services for you. 
https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/td/docs/voice_ip_comm/cucm/admin/12_5_1SU1/adminGd/cucm_b_administration-guide-1251SU1/cucm_b_test-adminguide_chapter_011110.html

Selected Answer: C
Referenced links are incorrect because CallManager service restart required for change in Domain Name of CUCM. 
Here we are changing DNS, I would go for 
C. restart of the network service
Else many docs suggest to restart cluster itself

choices.D: Video conferencing is classified as CoS 1, and voice is CoS 2.
choices.A: Voice is classified as CoS 4, and video conferencing is CoS 5.
choices.C: Voice and video conferencing are both classified is CoS 3.
choices.B: Voice is classified as CoS 5, and video conferencing is CoS 4.

discussion.content:
page10
https://www.cisco.com/c/dam/en_us/about/ciscoitatwork/downloads/ciscoitatwork/pdf/Cisco_IT_Case_Study_QoS_print.pdf

Selected Answer: B
Cisco CLCOR Official Cert guide book Chapter 13 - Table 13-2 Traffic Classification Map 
Voice Only: CoS 5
Voice/Video: CoS 4
Telepresence video: CoS 4
Therefore the answer is *B*

Selected Answer: B
Answer is B.
so is it B?

questions.question_text: What is the traffic classification for voice and video conferencing?
